story_prompt: The world ended 20 years ago, you haven't found a living soul since then. Through some ingenuity, you call voicemails for the last 20 years to keep you company. 'Hi, this is Cindy...' 'Hi you reached Bob' 'You know what to do at the beep' until one day 'Hello...hello? Oh my God hello!'

Settings:

Character Portraits:

Protagonist: 
Name: John
Age: 45
Occupation: former Teacher
Personality: Reserved, analytical, and introspective
Background: Was a teacher before the world ended, now survives by himself in an underground bunker.

Voice on the Other End: 
Name: Sarah
Age: 25
Occupation: College Student
Personality: Bright, optimistic, and curious
Background: Left message 20 years ago as a way to cope with the end of the world, still holds hope for humanity's survival.

Plot: 
The protagonist, John, has been living in an underground bunker for 20 years, ever since the world ended. He has called the voicemail box for 20 years, speaking to various people, all of whom have been lost to him forever. One day, he hears a new voice on the other end of the line, "Hello...hello? Oh my God hello!" Sarah, the voice on the other end, is a young college student who left the message 20 years ago as a way to cope with the end of the world. John is shocked and amazed to find someone else alive, and their conversation sparks a newfound hope and purpose for both of them. As they continue to talk, John realizes that he doesn't have to be alone anymore, and he begins to rebuild his life with Sarah's help.
